agol_oauth_implicit.description: AGOL OAuth Implicit Authentication - Browser-based User Logins https://developers.arcgis.com/authentication/browser-based-user-logins/

f.description: The output format can be HTML, JSON, or PJSON. The default is HTML. Search and item comments support RSS as an output format. Values: html, json, pjson
f.name: f

token.description: Generated by the generateToken call, an access token that identifies the authenticated user and controls access to restricted resources and operations.
token.name: token

start.description: The number of the first entry in the result set response. The index number is 1-based. The default value of start is 1 (that is, the first search result). The start parameter, along with the num parameter, can be used to paginate the search results. Example: start=11 (return result #11 as the first entry in the response)
start.name: start

num.description: The maximum number of results to be included in the result set response. The default value is 10, and the maximum allowed value is 100. The start parameter, along with the num parameter, can be used to paginate the search results.
num.name: num

q.name: q
q.description: The query string to search the groups against. See Search reference for advanced options. Example: q=arcgis+online. Search reference http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Search_reference/02r3000000mn000000/

sortField.name: sortField
sortField.description: Field to sort by. The allowed field names are title, owner, and created.

sortOrder.name: sortOrder
sortOrder.description: Describes whether order returns in ascending or descending order. Default is ascending.

applicationUsername.name: applicationUsername
applicationUsername.description: Name of the user applying to join the group

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Portals > Root

get.description: The Root resource only returns the version of the containing portal. It acts as a root to its child resources and operations. To obtain descriptive information about this portal including its name, logo, featured items, and supported protocols (HTTP vs HTTPS), access the Self resource under Portals.

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Community > Create Group

post.description: The Create Group operation (POST only) creates a new group in the Portal community. Only authenticated users can create groups. The user who creates the group automatically becomes the owner of the group. The owner of the group is automatically an administrator of the group. The calling user provides the title for the group, while the group ID is generated by the system.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The group title must be unique for the username, and the character limit is 250. Example: title=Redlands Fire Department

parameters.name: description
parameters.description: A description of the group that can be any length

parameters.name: snippet
parameters.description: Snippet or summary of the group that has a character limit of 250 characters

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Tags are words or short phrases that describe the group. Separate terms with commas. Example: tags=fire, Redlands, California, public safety

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: Phone is the group contact information. It can be a combination of letters and numbers. The character limit is 250. Example: phone=http://www.ci.redlands.ca.us/fire/index.htm, 35 Cajon Street, Redlands, CA 92373

parameters.name: access
parameters.description: Sets the access level for the group. private is the default. Setting to org restricts group access to members of your organization. If public, all users can access the group. Values: private | org |public. Example: access=org

parameters.name: sortField
parameters.description: Sets sort field for group items. Values: title | owner | avgrating |numviews| created | modified. Example: sortField=avgrating

parameters.name: sortOrder
parameters.description: Sets sort order for group items. Values: asc | desc. Example: sortOrder=desc

parameters.name: isViewOnly
parameters.description: Allows the group owner or admin to create view-only groups where members are not able to share items. If members try to share, view-only groups are returned in the notshared response property. false is the default. Values: false | true. Example: isViewOnly=true

parameters.name: isInvitationOnly
parameters.description: If true, this group will not accept join requests. If false, this group does not require an invitation to join. Only group owners and admins can invite users to the group. false is the default. Values: true | false. Example: isInvitationOnly=true

parameters.name: thumbnail
parameters.description: Enter the pathname to the thumbnail image to be used for the group. The recommended image size is 200 pixels wide by 133 pixels high. Acceptable image formats are PNG, GIF, and JPEG. The maximum file size for an image is 1 MB. This is not a reference to the file but the file itself, which will be stored in the Portal. Example: thumbnail=subfolder/thumbnail.jpg

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Community > Group Search

get.description: The Group Search operation searches for groups in the portal. The search index is updated whenever groups and organizations are created, updated, or deleted. There can be a lag between the time that a group is updated and the time when it's reflected in the search results. The results only contain groups that the user has permission to access. Care should be taken when using ArcGIS REST API search operations (search, user search, group search) to find items, groups, and users programmatically. The Portal uses a powerful search engine to index information and to allow full text searching on it. This search engine uses many different inputs to find the appropriate results and rank them. This often makes search 'fuzzy', making it ideal for human interaction, but not necessarily ideal for looking for specific records programmatically. Developers should avoid using search to find specific items (e.g. by title) as the results of these types of queries might change as the search engine evolves.

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Community > Group

get.description: The Group resource represents a group (for example, San Bernardino Fires) within the portal. The owner is automatically an administrator and is returned in the list of admins. Administrators can invite, add to, or remove members from a group as well as update or delete the group. The administrator for an organization can also reassign the group to another member of the organization. Group members can leave the group. Authenticated users can apply to join a group unless the group is by invitation only. The visibility of the group by other users is determined by the access property. If the group is private, no one other than the administrators and members of the group will be able to see it. If the group is shared with an organization, all members of the organization will be able to find it

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Community > Invite to Group

post.description: A group administrator can invite users to join their group using the Invite to Group operation. This creates a new user invitation, which the users accept or decline. The role of the user and the invitation expiration date can be set in the invitation. A notification is created for the user indicating that they were invited to join the group. Available only to authenticated users.

parameters.name: users
parameters.description: A comma separated list of usernames to be invited to the group. If a user is already a member of the group or an invitation has already been sent, the call still returns a success. Example: users=regularusername1,regularusername2

parameters.name: role
parameters.description: Allows administrators to set the user's role in the group. Roles are: group_member: Ability to view and share items with group. group_admin: In addition to viewing and sharing items, the group_admin has the same capabilities as the group owner—invite users to the group, accept or decline group applications, delete content, and remove users.

parameters.name: expiration
parameters.description: Expiration date on the invitation can be set for one day, three days, one week, or two weeks, in minutes. Example: expiration=1440

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Community > Add Users to Group

post.description: The operation to Add Users to Group (POST only) is available only to the group administrators, including the owner, and to the administrator of the organization if the user is a member. Both users and admins can be added using this operation. This is useful if you wish to add users directly within an organization without requiring them to accept an invitation. For example, a member of an organization can add only other organization members but not public users

parameters.name: users
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of usernames (both admins and regular users) to be added to the group. Example: users=regularusername1,adminusername1,adminusername2,regularusername2

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Community > Group Applications

get.description: Lists the group applications for the given group. Available to administrators of the group or administrators of an organization if the group is part of one

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Community > Group Application

get.description: When an individual user applies to join a group, a group application is created. The group administrators can accept or decline the application. Available only to the group administrators and the administrator of the organization if the group belongs to an organization

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Community > Accept Group Application

post.description: When a user applies to join a group, a group application is created. Group administrators choose to accept this application using the Accept Group Application operation (POST only). This operation adds the applying user to the group then deletes the application. This operation also creates a notification for the user indicating that the user's group application was accepted. Available only to group owners and admins

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Community > Decline Group Application

post.description: When a user applies to join a group, a group application is created. Group administrators can decline this application using the Decline Group Application operation (POST only). This operation deletes the application and creates a notification for the user indicating that the user's group application was declined. The applying user will not be added to the group. Available only to group owners and admins

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Community > Delete Group

post.description: The Delete Group operation (POST only) is available only to the group administrators or to the administrator of the organization to which the owner belongs

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Community > Join Group

post.description: Users apply to join a group using the Join Group operation (POST only). This creates a new group application, which the group administrators accept or decline. This operation also creates a notification for the user indicating that they have applied to join this group. Available only to authenticated users. Users can only apply to join groups to which they have access. If the group is private, users will not be able to find it to ask to join it. Information pertaining to the applying user, such as their full name and username, can be sent as part of the group application.

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Community > Leave Group

post.description: The Leave Group operation (POST only) is available to all group members other than the group owner. Leaving a group automatically results in the unsharing of all items the user has shared with the group.

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Community > Reassign Group

post.description: The Reassign Group operation (POST only) allows the administrator of an organization to reassign a group to another member of the organization.

parameters.name: targetUsername
parameters.description: The target username of the new owner of the group. Example: organization_username1

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Community > Remove Users from Group

post.description: The operation to Remove Users From Group (POST only) is available only to the group administrators, including the owner, and to the administrator of the organization if the user is a member. Both users and admins can be removed using this operation. Group owners cannot be removed from the group.

parameters.name: users
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of usernames (both admins and regular users) to be removed from the group. Example: users=regularusername1,adminusername1,adminusername2,            regularusername2

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Community > Group Users

get.description: Lists the users, owner, and administrators of a given group. Only available to members or administrators of the group

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Community > Self

get.description: This resource allows discovery of the current authenticated user identified by the token

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Community > User

get.description: A user resource representing a registered user of the portal. Personal details of the user, such as e-mail and groups, are returned only to the user or the administrator of the user's organization (the properties in the Response Properties table below). A user is not visible to any other user (except the organization's administrator) if their access setting is set to 'private.

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Community > Delete User

post.description: The Delete User operation (POST only) is available only to the user in question or to the administrator of the user's organization. If deleting a user who is part of an organization, their content and groups must be transferred to another member or deleted prior to deleting the user. If the user is not part of an organization, all content and groups of the user must first be deleted. Deleting a user whose identity provider is the Esri Global Account will not delete the user from the Esri Global Account system.

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Community > Disable User

post.description: The Disable operation (POST only) disables login access for the user. It is only available to the administrator of the organization.

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Community > Enable User

post.description: The Enable operation (POST only) enables login access for the user. It is only available to the administrator of the organization.

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Community > User Invitations

get.description: Shows the invitations sent to the authenticated user

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Community > User Invitation

get.description: An individual invitation to join a given group. The user can accept the invitation or decline the invitation. Invitations are currently only to join groups but may be extended in the future to allow for other targetTypes. Developers should design their applications so that targetTypes is checked and unknown targetTypes are ignored. Invitations are also currently only sent to usernames. This is determined by the type property of the invitation. In the future, other types of invitations may be introduced. Developers should design their applications to make sure they check type and ignore unknown types

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Community > Accept Invitation

post.description: When a group owner or an administrator invites a user to their group, it results in a user invitation. The invited user accepts the invitation using the Accept Invitation operation (POST only). This operation adds the invited user to the group, and the invitation is deleted. This operation also creates a notification for the user indicating that the user's invitation was accepted. Available only to authenticated users

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Community > Decline Invitation

post.description: When a group administrator invites a user to their group, it results in a group invitation. The invited user can decline the invitation using the Decline Invitation operation (POST only). The operation deletes the invitation and creates a notification for the user indicating that they declined the invitation. The invited user is not added to the group. Available only to authenticated users

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Community > Notification

get.description: An individual notification for the given user that can be of different types as described in the Notification types section below. Available only to the user recipient of the notification. In the JSON response for a notification, the data property will vary based on the notification type

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Community > Notifications

get.description: The list of notifications available for the given user. These can have different types as described in the documentation for the Notification resource

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Community > Delete Notification

post.description: The Delete Notification operation (POST only) is available only to the user who receives the notification

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Community > Update User

post.description: The Update User operation (POST only) modifies properties such as description, preferred view, tags, access, and thumbnail. The user name cannot be modified. For the 'ecas' identity provider, password, e-mail, and full name must be modified by editing your Esri Global Account. For the 'arcgis' identity provider, password, full name, security question, and security answer can be updated with Update User. Update User is available only to the user or to the administrator of the user's organization. Only the properties that are to be updated need to be specified in the request. Properties not specified will not be affected.

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Community > User Tags

get.description: Users tag the content they publish in their portal via the add and update item calls. This resource lists all the tags used by the user along with the number of times the tags have been used

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Content > Group Content

get.description: The group's content provides access to the items that are shared with the group. Group items are stored by reference and are not physically stored in a group. Rather, they are stored as links to the original item in the item resource (/content/items/<itemId>). Available only to the users of the group and the administrator of the organization to which the group belongs, if any

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Portals > Item

get.description: An item (a unit of content) in the portal. Each item has a unique identifier and a well known URL that is independent of the user owning the item. An item can have associated binary or textual data that's available via the item data resource. For example, an item of type Map Package returns the actual bits corresponding to the map package via the item data resource. The numViews is incremented when an item is opened

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Content > Add Comment

post.description: Adds a comment to an item (POST only). Available only to authenticated users who have access to the item

parameters.name: comment
parameters.description: Text of the comment to be added

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Content > Item Comments

get.description: Lists all comments for an item

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Content > Item Comment

get.description: Gets details for a particular comment

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Content > Groups

get.description: Lists the groups of which the item is a part. Only shows the groups that the calling user can access

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Content > Item Rating

get.description: Lists all comments for an item

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Content > Related Items

get.description: Gets all the related items of a certain relationship type for that item. An optional direction can be specified if the direction of the relationship is ambiguous. Otherwise, the service will try to infer it

parameters.name: relationshipType
parameters.description: The type of relationship between the two items. See Relationship types for a complete listing of types

parameters.name: direction
parameters.description: The direction of the relationship. Either forward (from origin -> destination) or reverse (from destination -> origin)

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Content > Add Item Part

post.description: Add Item Part allows the caller to upload a file part when doing an add or update item operation in multipart mode. Each upload takes an integer part number that indicates the order of this part compared to others. Each part can be uploaded at any time, in any order, even simultaneously. Each file part must be uploaded in an HTTP multipart request pursuant to IETF RFC1867.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: The file to be uploaded

parameters.name: partNum
parameters.description: Part numbers can be any number from 1 to 10,000, inclusive. A part number uniquely identifies a part and also defines its position within the object being created. If you upload a new part using the same part number that was used with a previous part, the previously uploaded part is overwritten. Each part must be at least five (5) megabytes, except the last part. There is no size requirement on the last part of a multipart upload. Example: partNum=1

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Content > Add Rating

post.description: Adds a rating to an item to which you have access (POST only). Only one rating can be given to an item per user. If this call is made on a currently rated item, the new rating will overwrite the existing rating. A user cannot rate their own item. Available only to authenticated users

parameters.name: rating
parameters.description: Rating to set for the item. Rating must be a floating point number between 1.0 and 5.0.

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Content > Delete Comment

post.description: Deletes the particular comment (POST only). This functionality is available to authenticated users who originally created the comment and item owners on items that they own

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Content > Add Item

post.description:
The Add Item operation (POST only) is used to upload an item file, submit text content, or submit the item URL to the specified user folder depending on documented items and item types. This operation is available only to the specified user. The request to upload an item file must be a multipart request pursuant to IETF RFC1867. The request to submit text content or a URL can be a standard HTTP POST request. The user owning the folder automatically becomes the owner of the item. The item is flagged as private (that is, not shared with any group) by default. This can be changed using the Share Item operation. The added item is available to everyone it's shared with at the item resource. The item is also available to the owner at the user item resource, which supports operations to update, delete, move, share, and unshare items. The addItem operation allows users to optionally create a relationship and share an item in one call. See Add Relationship for parameter information. The same rules apply, with the following exceptions: 
If you specify an originItemId, the new item is added as the destination item. 
If you specify a destinationitemId, the new item is added as the origin item. 
If you specify both, an error is thrown. 
The relationship creation is done after the item is created. 
If the item doesn’t add correctly, no relationship is created. 
If the item adds correctly, but the relationship fails (that is, bad relationship type, invalid origin or destination item, and so on), the item is deleted. 
The destination item will inherit all the sharing permissions of the origin item. 
The filename or URL used for an item must be unique within the particular user's folder.

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: The file to be uploaded. If uploading a file, the request must be a multipart request

parameters.name: dataUrl
parameters.description: The URL where the item can be downloaded. The resource will be downloaded and stored as a file type. Similar to uploading a file to be added, but instead of transferring the contents of the file, the URL of the data file is referenced and creates a file item. Please see the implementation details section (in the documentation article) which discusses this parameter in further details

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL of the item to be submitted. The URL can be a URL to a service, a web mapping application, or any other content available at that URL. Example: url=http://server.arcgisonline.com/ArcGIS/rest/services/ESRI_Imagery_World_2D/MapServer

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text content for the item to be submitted. Example: text=Any+plain+text+content

parameters.name: relationshipType
parameters.description: The type of relationship between the two items. See Relationship types for a complete listing of types. Example: WMA2Code

parameters.name: originItemId
parameters.description: The item ID of the origin item of the relationship. Example: bb297e5eac6d489e85993d5e4d4e4a20

parameters.name: destinationItemId
parameters.description: The item ID of the destination item of the relationship. Example: 8d292f9b0cd5457bbdad84c02223ffb8

parameters.name: async
parameters.description: If true, the file is uploaded asynchronously. If false, the file is uploaded synchronously. Default is false. Example: async=true

parameters.name: multipart
parameters.description: If true, the file is uploaded in multiple parts. See the Multipart Uploads section above for more information

parameters.name: filename
parameters.description: The filename being uploaded in multipart mode. Required if multipart=true

parameters.name: serviceProxyParams
parameters.description: A JSON object that provides rate limiting and referrer checks when accessing secured services. Example: serviceProxyParams: "hitsPerInterval":2,"intervalSeconds":60,"referrers":["http://<servername>"]}

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Content > User Content

get.description: The user's content are items either in the home folder for the user, e.g. /content/users/<username>, or in a subfolder of the home folder with the given folder ID. Multilevel folders are not supported. You can also see the Quick reference topic for additional information on this. Items in a folder are stored by reference and are not physically in a folder. Rather, they're stored as links to the original item, e.g. /content/items/<itemId>

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Content > Create Folder

post.description: Creates a folder in which items can be placed. Folders are only visible to a user and solely used for organizing content within that user's content space. The create user folder operation (POST only) is available only on the user's root folder. Multilevel folders are not supported. The user provides the title for the folder, which must be unique to that user. The folder ID is generated by the system.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The folder title. Two folders that belong to the same user cannot have the same title.

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Content > Create Service

post.description: The Create Service operation (POST only) allows users to create a hosted feature service. You can use the API to create an empty hosted feaure service from feature service metadata JSON

parameters.name: createParameters
parameters.description: A JSON object specifying the properties of the newly-created service

name.description: Name of the service to be created. This name must be unique. If the name already exists, the operation will fail

hasStaticData.description: Boolean value indicating whether the data changes

maxRecordCount.description: A double value indicating any constraints enforced on query operations

supportedQueryFormats.description: The formats in which query results are returned

capabilities.description: Specify feature service editing capabilities for Create, Delete, Query, Update, and Sync. The value is a comma-delimited (no spaces) string of some of these values: Create, Delete, Query, Update, Sync

description.description: A user-friendly description for the published dataset

copyrightText.description: Copyright information associated with the dataset

spatialReference.description: All layers added to a hosted feature service need to have the same spatial reference defined for the feature service. When creating a new empty service without specifying its spatial reference, the spatial reference of the hosted feature service is set to the first layer added to that feature service

initialExtent.description: The initial extent set for the service

allowGeometryUpdates.description: Boolean value indicating if updating the geometry of the service is permitted

units.description: Units used by the feature service

xssPreventionInfo.description: A JSON object specifying the properties of cross-site scripting prevention

xssPreventionEnabled.description: Boolean value indicating whether cross-site scripting prevention is enabled

parameters.name: outputType
parameters.description: The newly-created service type

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Content > Delete Folder

post.description: The delete user folder operation (POST only) is available only on the user's non-root folders. The user's root folder cannot be deleted. Deleting a folder also deletes all items that it contains (both the items and the links are removed)

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Generate Token

post.description: This operation generates an access token in exchange for user credentials that can be used by clients when working with the ArcGIS Portal API. The call is only allowed over HTTPS and must be a POST. The access token represents the authenticated user for a certain amount of time to all other API functionality. Developers using the API must take care to protect the token against malicious use just as they would the original credentials, and they must be prepared to renew the token. Expired tokens will be rejected by the server. From version 2.1, the generateToken operation also supports generation of a server-token in exchange for a portal token. This server-token is required for clients to access resources from a federated server. The parameters token and serverUrl are required to generate a server-token. See the descriptions of these parameters below for additional information. Organizations that choose to implement higher levels of security for their organizations can set the allSSL setting to true for their organization or portal. The effect of setting allSSL to true is that all non-HTTPS requests for resources belonging to the organization will be rejected. Setting allSSL to true guarantees that all transmissions of access tokens as well as data between clients and servers is over a secure encrypted channel and provides protection to tokens and data in transit. When generateToken is called for a user in such an organization, it returns a response property of ssl=true, and the token must always be passed back via HTTPS to the portal.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: Username of user who wants to get a token

parameters.name: password
parameters.description: Password of user who wants to get a token

parameters.name: client
parameters.description: The client type that will be granted access to the token. Only the referer value is supported. In the Generate Token page, select the Webapp URL option to specify the referer.

parameters.name: referer
parameters.description: The base URL of the client application that will use the token to access the Portal for ArcGIS API. In the Generate Token page, the referer is specified in the Webapp URL field, for example: referer=http: //myserver/mywebapp

parameters.name: expiration
parameters.description: The token expiration time in minutes. The default is 60 minutes. The maximum expiration period is 15 days. Example: expiration=60 (1 hour). The maximum value of the expiration time is controlled by the server. Requests for tokens larger than this time will be rejected. Applications are responsible for renewing expired tokens; expired tokens will be rejected by the server on subsequent requests that use the token.

parameters.name: token
parameters.description: Portal token generated in exchange for user credentials for use by clients working with a federated server. Example: token=<portalToken>. This parameter is required only when generating a server-token. Username, password, client, referrer, and expiration parameters are not required for generating a server-token. The referrer and expiration time of the portal token will be applied to the server-token.

parameters.name: serverURL
parameters.description: URL of a federated server for which a server-token needs to be generated. Example: serverUrl=<http://myserver.esri.com/arcgis>. A server-token will be returned only if the serverUrl contains the URL of a server that is registered with the portal. A server-token will not be generated for a server that is not registered with the portal.

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Portals > Languages

get.description: Lists the available languages

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Portals > Server

get.description: This resource represents an ArcGIS Server site that has been federated with the portal. This resource is not applicable to ArcGIS Online; it is only applicable to Portal for ArcGIS

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Portals > Regions

get.description: Lists the available regions

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Portals > Resources

get.description: Resources lists all file resources for the organization. The start and num paging parameters are supported.

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Portals > Self

get.description: The Portal Self resource is used to return the view of the portal as seen by the current user, anonymous or logged in. It includes information such as the name, logo, featured items, and supported protocols (HTTP vs. HTTPS) for this portal. If the user is not logged in, this call will return the default view of the portal. If the user is logged in, the view of the returned portal will be specific to the organization to which the user belongs. The default view of the portal is dependent on the culture of the user, which is obtained from the user's profile. A parameter to pass in the locale/culture is available for anonymous users.

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Portals > Servers

get.description: This resource lists the ArcGIS Server sites that have been federated with the portal. This resource is not applicable to ArcGIS Online; it is only applicable to Portal for ArcGIS

externalDocs.description: Managing your organization > Portals > Users

get.description: Lists all the members of the organization. The start and num paging parameters are supported

acceptGroupApplication.description: When a user applies to join a group, a group application is created. Group administrators choose to accept this application using the Accept Group Application operation (POST only). This operation adds the applying user to the group then deletes the application. This operation also creates a notification for the user indicating that the user's group application was accepted. Available only to group owners and admins. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Accept_Group_Application/02r300000069000000/
acceptGroupApplication.title: acceptGroupApplication

success.description: Indicates if the operation was successful

username.description: The username of the user being accepted into the group

groupId.description: The group ID of the group that accepted the user's application

acceptInvitation.description: When a group owner or an administrator invites a user to their group, it results in a user invitation. The invited user accepts the invitation using the Accept Invitation operation (POST only). This operation adds the invited user to the group, and the invitation is deleted. This operation also creates a notification for the user indicating that the user's invitation was accepted. Available only to authenticated users. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Accept_Invitation/02r3000000m4000000/
acceptInvitation.title: acceptInvitation

success.description: Indicates if the operation was successful

id.description: The ID of the accepted invitation

username.description: The username of the user who accepted the invitation

groupId.description: If the targetType of the invitation is 'group,' the groupId of the joined group is returned

addComment.description: Adds a comment to an item (POST only). Available only to authenticated users who have access to the item. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Add_Comment/02r300000090000000/
addComment.title: addComment

success.description: Set to true if the comment was posted successfully

commentId.description: The ID of the comment submitted

addItem.description: The Add Item operation (POST only) is used to upload an item file, submit text content, or submit the item URL to the specified user folder depending on documented items and item types. This operation is available only to the specified user. The request to upload an item file must be a multipart request pursuant to IETF RFC1867. The request to submit text content or a URL can be a standard HTTP POST request. The user owning the folder automatically becomes the owner of the item. The item is flagged as private (that is, not shared with any group) by default. This can be changed using the Share Item operation. The added item is available to everyone it's shared with at the item resource. The item is also available to the owner at the user item resource, which supports operations to update, delete, move, share, and unshare items. The addItem operation allows users to optionally create a relationship and share an item in one call. See Add Relationship for parameter information. The same rules apply, with the following exceptions: If you specify an originItemId, the new item is added as the destination item. If you specify a destinationitemId, the new item is added as the origin item. If you specify both, an error is thrown. The relationship creation is done after the item is created. If the item doesn’t add correctly, no relationship is created. If the item adds correctly, but the relationship fails (that is, bad relationship type, invalid origin or destination item, and so on), the item is deleted. The destination item will inherit all the sharing permissions of the origin item. The filename or URL used for an item must be unique within the particular user's folder. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Add_Item/02r30000008q000000/
addItem.title: addItem

success.description: Indicates if the operation was successful

id.description: The ID of the created item

folder.description: The folder in which the item was created

addItemPart.description: Add Item Part allows the caller to upload a file part when doing an add or update item operation in multipart mode. Each upload takes an integer part number that indicates the order of this part compared to others. Each part can be uploaded at any time, in any order, even simultaneously. Each file part must be uploaded in an HTTP multipart request pursuant to IETF RFC1867. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Add_Item_Part/02r300000094000000/
addItemPart.title: addItemPart

success.description: Indicates if the operation was successful

id.description: The ID of the item containing part

addRating.description: Adds a rating to an item to which you have access (POST only). Only one rating can be given to an item per user. If this call is made on a currently rated item, the new rating will overwrite the existing rating. A user cannot rate their own item. Available only to authenticated users. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Add_Rating/02r30000007v000000/
addRating.title: addRating

success.description: Indicates if the operation was successful

addUsersToGroup.description: The operation to Add Users to Group (POST only) is available only to the group administrators, including the owner, and to the administrator of the organization if the user is a member. Both users and admins can be added using this operation. This is useful if you wish to add users directly within an organization without requiring them to accept an invitation. For example, a member of an organization can add only other organization members but not public users. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Add_Users_to_Group/02r3000002mr000000/
addUsersToGroup.title: addUsersToGroup

notAdded.description: A JSON array of usernames that were not added

createFolder.description: Creates a folder in which items can be placed. Folders are only visible to a user and solely used for organizing content within that user's content space. The create user folder operation (POST only) is available only on the user's root folder. Multilevel folders are not supported. The user provides the title for the folder, which must be unique to that user. The folder ID is generated by the system. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Create_Folder/02r300000074000000/
createFolder.title: createFolder

success.description: Indicates if the operation was successful

folder.description: Folder JSON object that describes the folder just created

username.description: The username of the person who created the folder

createGroup.description: The Create Group operation (POST only) creates a new group in the Portal community. Only authenticated users can create groups. The user who creates the group automatically becomes the owner of the group. The owner of the group is automatically an administrator of the group. The calling user provides the title for the group, while the group ID is generated by the system. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Create_Group/02r30000009w000000/
createGroup.title: createGroup

success.description: Indicates if the operation was successful

group.description: The JSON group object representing the created group. See the Group response properties for the properties returned

createService.description: The Create Service operation (POST only) allows users to create a hosted feature service. You can use the API to create an empty hosted feaure service from feature service metadata JSON. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Create_Service/02r30000027r000000/
createService.title: createService

encodedServiceURL.description: The encoded URL to the hosted service

itemId.description: The unique ID for this item

serviceItemId.description: The ID of the new service item

serviceurl.description: The URL to the hosted service

success.description: Indicates if the operation was successful

description.description: The description of the new service item

tags.description: The tags used to describe the service item

snippet.description: A short summary description of the item

declineGroupApplication.description: When a user applies to join a group, a group application is created. Group administrators can decline this application using the Decline Group Application operation (POST only). This operation deletes the application and creates a notification for the user indicating that the user's group application was declined. The applying user will not be added to the group. Available only to group owners and admins. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Decline_Group_Application/02r30000006q000000/
declineGroupApplication.title: declineGroupApplication

success.description: Indicates if the operation was successful

username.description: The username of the user being declined from joining the group

groupId.description: The group ID of the group that declined the user

declineInvitation.description: When a group administrator invites a user to their group, it results in a group invitation. The invited user can decline the invitation using the Decline Invitation operation (POST only). The operation deletes the invitation and creates a notification for the user indicating that they declined the invitation. The invited user is not added to the group. Available only to authenticated users. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Decline_Invitation/02r3000000m8000000/
declineInvitation.title: declineInvitation

success.description: Indicates if the operation was successful

id.description: The ID of the declined invitation

username.description: The username of the user who declined the invitation

groupId.description: If the targetType of the invitation is 'group,' the groupId of the group declined is returned

deleteComment.description: Deletes the particular comment (POST only). This functionality is available to authenticated users who originally created the comment and item owners on items that they own. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Delete_Comment/02r300000072000000/
deleteComment.title: deleteComment

success.description: Set to true if the comment was deleted successfully

commentId.description: The ID of the deleted submitted

deleteFolder.description: The delete user folder operation (POST only) is available only on the user's non-root folders. The user's root folder cannot be deleted. Deleting a folder also deletes all items that it contains (both the items and the links are removed). http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Delete_Folder/02r30000008m000000/
deleteFolder.title: deleteFolder

success.description: Indicates if the operation was successful

folder.description: Folder JSON object that describes the folder just deleted

username.description: The username of the person who deleted the folder

deleteGroup.description: The Delete Group operation (POST only) is available only to the group administrators or to the administrator of the organization to which the owner belongs. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Delete_Group/02r300000070000000/
deleteGroup.title: deleteGroup

success.description: Indicates if the operation was successful

groupId.description: The ID of the deleted group

deleteNotification.description: The Delete Notification operation (POST only) is available only to the user who receives the notification. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Delete_Notification/02r3000000mv000000/
deleteNotification.title: deleteNotification

success.description: Indicates if the operation was successful

notificationId.description: The ID of the deleted notification

deleteUser.description: The Delete User operation (POST only) is available only to the user in question or to the administrator of the user's organization. If deleting a user who is part of an organization, their content and groups must be transferred to another member or deleted prior to deleting the user. If the user is not part of an organization, all content and groups of the user must first be deleted. Deleting a user whose identity provider is the Esri Global Account will not delete the user from the Esri Global Account system. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Delete_User/02r3000000mw000000/
deleteUser.title: deleteUser

success.description: Indicates if the operation was successful

username.description: The username of the deleted user

disableUser.description: The Disable operation (POST only) disables login access for the user. It is only available to the administrator of the organization. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/index.html#/Disable/02r30000026m000000/
disableUser.title: disableUser

success.description: Indicates if the operation was successful

user.description: The username of the user to disable

enableUser.description: The Enable operation (POST only) enables login access for the user. It is only available to the administrator of the organization. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Enable/02r30000026p000000/
enableUser.title: enableUser

success.description: Indicates if the operation was successful

user.description: The username of the user to enable

generateToken.description: This operation generates an access token in exchange for user credentials that can be used by clients when working with the ArcGIS Portal API. The call is only allowed over HTTPS and must be a POST. The access token represents the authenticated user for a certain amount of time to all other API functionality. Developers using the API must take care to protect the token against malicious use just as they would the original credentials, and they must be prepared to renew the token. Expired tokens will be rejected by the server. From version 2.1, the generateToken operation also supports generation of a server-token in exchange for a portal token. This server-token is required for clients to access resources from a federated server. The parameters token and serverUrl are required to generate a server-token. See the descriptions of these parameters below for additional information. Organizations that choose to implement higher levels of security for their organizations can set the allSSL setting to true for their organization or portal. The effect of setting allSSL to true is that all non-HTTPS requests for resources belonging to the organization will be rejected. Setting allSSL to true guarantees that all transmissions of access tokens as well as data between clients and servers is over a secure encrypted channel and provides protection to tokens and data in transit. When generateToken is called for a user in such an organization, it returns a response property of ssl=true, and the token must always be passed back via HTTPS to the portal. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Generate_Token/02r3000000m5000000/
generateToken.title: generateToken

expires.description: The expiration time of the token in milliseconds since Jan. 1, 1970 (UTC)

ssl.description: True if the tokem must always pass over ssl

getCommunity.description: This resource allows discovery of the current authenticated user identified by the token. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Self/02r300000079000000/
getCommunity.title: getCommunity

user.description: A user resource representing a registered user of the portal

getExtent.description: The bounding rectangle of the item. Should always be in WGS84
getExtent.title: extent

getFolder.description: The current folder listing the user's items
getFolder.title: folder

created.description: The date the folder was created. Shown in UNIX time.

getGroup.description: The Group resource represents a group within the portal. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/index.html#/Group/02r30000006m000000/
getGroup.title: group

title.description: The title of the group. This is the name that is displayed to users and by which they refer to the group. Every group must have a title, and it must be unique for a user.

isInvitationOnly.description: If this is set to true, users will not be able to apply to join the group

owner.description: The owner username of the group

tags.description: User-defined tags that describe the group

phone.description: The contact information for the group

sortOrder.description: The sort order, either descending or ascending

isViewOnly.description: Boolean value indicating whether the results are only for viewing

isFav.description: Boolean value indicating whether marked in favorites

thumbnail.description: The URL to the thumbnail used for the group. All group thumbnails are relative to the URL: http://<community-url>/groups/<groupId>/info

created.description: The date the group was created. Shown in UNIX time in milliseconds

modified.description: The date the group was last modified. Shown in UNIX time in milliseconds

access.description: The access privileges of the group that determine who can see and access the group. Can be: private, org, or public

userMembership.description: If the request is made by an authenticated user, a JSON object is returned containing information about the user's access to the group. This includes the username of the calling user, the memberType, which specifies the type of membership the user has in the group (owner, member, admin, none), and the applications (number of requests to join the group) count available to admins and owners

memberType.description: Specifies the type of membership the user has in the group (owner, member, admin, none)

applications.description: Number of requests to join the group available to admins and owners.

getGroupApplication.description: When an individual user applies to join a group, a group application is created. The group administrators can accept or decline the application. Available only to the group administrators and the administrator of the organization if the group belongs to an organization. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/index.html#/Group_Application/02r30000006r000000/
getGroupApplication.title: groupApplication

username.description: The username of the user applying to join the group

fullname.description: The full name of the user applying to join the group

received.description: The date the application was received in UNIX time in milliseconds

getGroupApplications.description: Lists the group applications for the given group. Available to administrators of the group or administrators of an organization if the group is part of one. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/index.html#/Group_Applications/02r300000068000000/
getGroupApplications.title: groupApplications

applications.description: A JSON array of application objects. See Group Application for property information

getGroupContent.description: The group's content provides access to the items that are shared with the group. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/index.html#/Group_Content/02r300000081000000/
getGroupContent.title: groupContent

items.description: A JSON array of item objects. See Item for response properties for more details

getGroupUsers.description: Lists the users, owner, and administrators of a given group. Only available to members or administrators of the group http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/index.html#/Group_Users/02r30000006p000000/
getGroupUsers.title: groupUsers

owner.description: The username of the owner of the group

admins.description: A JSON array containing the usernames of the administrators of the group

users.description: A JSON array containing the usernames of the members of the group

getItem.description: An item (a unit of content) in the portal. Each item has a unique identifier and a well known URL that is independent of the user owning the item. An item can have associated binary or textual data that's available via the item data resource. For example, an item of type Map Package returns the actual bits corresponding to the map package via the item data resource. The numViews is incremented when an item is opened. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/index.html#/Item/02r30000007w000000/
getItem.title: item

id.description: The unique ID for this item

owner.description: The username of the user who owns this item

created.description: The date the folder was created. Shown in UNIX time

modified.description: The date the folder was last modified. Shown in UNIX time

name.description: The file name of the item for file types. Read-only

title.description: The title of the item. This is the name that's displayed to users and by which they refer to the item. Every item must have a title

type.description: The GIS content type of this item. Example types include Web Map, Map Service, Shapefile, and Web Mapping Application. See the overview section of Items and item types to get an understanding of the item type hierarchy
type.pattern: Web Map|CityEngine Web Scene|Web Scene|Pro Map|Feature Service|Map Service|Image Service|KML|WMS|Feature Collection|Feature Collection Template|Geodata Service|Globe Service|Geometry Service|Geocoding Service|Network Analysis Service|Geoprocessing Service|Workflow Manager Service|Web Mapping Application|Mobile Application|Code Attachment|Operations Dashboard Add In|Operation View|Operations Dashboard Extension|Native Application|Native Application Template|Native Application Installer|Symbol Set|Color Set|Shapefile|File geodatabase|CSV|CAD Drawing|Service Definition|Document Link|Microsoft Word|Microsoft Powerpoint|Microsoft Excel|PDF|Image|Visio Document|iWork Keynote|iWork Pages|iWork Numbers|Map Document|Map Package|Mobile Basemap Package|Tile Package|Project Package|Task File|ArcPad Package|Explorer Map|Globe Document|Scene Document|Published Map|Map Template|Windows Mobile Package|Layout|Project Template|Layer|Layer Package|Explorer Layer|Desktop Style|Geoprocessing Package|Geoprocessing Package (Pro Version)|Geoprocessing Sample|Locator Package|Rule Package|Raster function template|Workflow Manager Package|Desktop Application|Desktop Application Template|Code Sample|Desktop Add In|Explorer Add In

typeKeywords.description: A set of keywords that further describes the type of this item. Each item is tagged with a set of type keywords that are derived based on its primary type

tags.description: User defined tags that describe the item

snippet.description: A short summary description of the item

thumbnail.description: The URL to the thumbnail used for the item. Relative to Item's URL

largeThumbnail.description: Primarily applies to thumbnails associated with an application. The URL to the thumbnail used for the application. Relative to Item's URL

banner.description: Primarily applies to the banner associated with an application. The URL to the banner used for the application. Relative to Item's URL

screenshots.description: Primarily applies to screenshots associated with an application. The URL to the screenshots used for the application

spatialReference.description: The coordinate system of the item

accessInformation.description: Information on the source of the item and its copyright status

culture.description: The item locale information (language and country)

languages.description: Primarily applies to languages associated with the application

url.description: The URL for the resource represented by the item. Applies only to items that represent web-accessible resources such as map services

access.description: Indicates the level of access to this item: private, shared, org, or public

commentsEnabled.description: Indicates if comments are allowed on the item

numComments.description: Number of comments on this item

numRatings.description: Number of ratings for this item

numViews.description: Total number of views for this item

industries.description: Primarily applies to industries associated with the application

listed.description: If true, the item is listed in the marketplace

ownerFolder.description: The ID of the folder in which the owner has stored the item. The property is only returned to the item owner or the org admin

protected.description: Protects the item from deletion. false is the default

getItemComment.description: Gets details for a particular comment. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/index.html#/Item_Comment/02r300000091000000/
getItemComment.title: comment

owner.description: The username of the user who submitted the comment

created.description: The date and time the comment was created. Shown in UNIX time

getItemComments.description: Lists all comments for an item. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/index.html#/Item_Comments/02r300000088000000/
getItemComments.title: comments

comments.description: A JSON array of comment objects. See the response properties for Comment for details

getItemGroups.description: Lists the groups of which the item is a part. Only shows the groups that the calling user can access http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/index.html#/Groups/02r30000009p000000/
getItemGroups.title: groups

admin.description: Groups which user is an administrator. This is a JSON Array of group objects. See Group for possible response properties

member.description: Groups which user is a member

other.description: Other groups that are public or shared to the user's organization but that the user is not a member of

getItemRating.description: Returns the rating given by the current user to the item, if any. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/index.html#/Item_Rating/02r300000098000000/
getItemRating.title: rating

rating.description: The rating given to the item by the calling user

created.description: The date and time the comment was created. Shown in UNIX time

getNotification.description: An individual notification for the given user that can be of different types. Available only to the user recipient of the notification. In the JSON response for a notification, the data property will vary based on the notification type. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/index.html#/Notification/02r30000006t000000/
getNotification.title: notification

type.description: The notification type. See the Notification types section for the list of notification types

target.description: The intended user of the notification

targetType.description: Currently, only "user" is acceptable, but in the future, there may be other target types for notifications

received.description: Date the notification was received, in UNIX time in milliseconds

data.description: The data for the notification. See the Notification types section for data properties for each notification type

getNotifications.description: The list of notifications available for the given user. These can have different types as described in the documentation for the Notification resource. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/index.html#/Notifications/02r30000006s000000/
getNotifications.title: notifications

notifications.description: JSON array of notification objects. See Notification for the properties of an invitation

getOrgRoot.description: The Root resource only returns the version of the containing portal. It acts as a root to its child resources and operations. To obtain descriptive information about this portal including its name, logo, featured items, and supported protocols (HTTP vs HTTPS), access the Self resource under Portals. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/index.html#/Root/02r30000009t000000/
getOrgRoot.title: root

currentVersion.description: The release version for this portal

getPortalAppInfo.description: Information about the Application through which this resource was accessed. This information is based on the token used to access this resource. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Portal_Self/02r3000001m7000000/
getPortalAppInfo.title: portalAppInfo

appID.description: The AppID of the registered Application. This is also the OAuth client_id

itemId.description: The item ID of the registered Application

orgId.description: The organization to which the Application owner belongs

getPortalFeaturedGroup.description: The featured groups for the organization. These are the groups that will be highlighted on the Groups page. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Portal_Self/02r3000001m7000000/
getPortalFeaturedGroup.title: portalFeaturedGroup

owner.description: The owner of the featured group

title.description: The title of the featured group

getPortalResource.description: resource objects that contain the key, size, and created date of the resource. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Resources/02r30000009r000000/
getPortalResource.title: resource

created.description: The date and time the resource was created. Shown in UNIX time

getPortalResources.description: Resources lists all file resources for the organization. The start and num paging parameters are supported. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Resources/02r30000009r000000/
getPortalResources.title: resources

total.description: The total number of results found

start.description: The number of the first entry in the result set response. The index number is 1-based

num.description: The number of results included in this result set response

nextStart.description: The next entry index if the current result set doesn't contain all results

resources.description: A JSON array of resource objects that contain the key, size, and created date of the resource

getPortalSelf.description: The Portal Self resource is used to return the view of the portal as seen by the current user, anonymous or logged in. It includes information such as the name, logo, featured items, and supported protocols (HTTP vs. HTTPS) for this portal. If the user is not logged in, this call will return the default view of the portal. If the user is logged in, the view of the returned portal will be specific to the organization to which the user belongs. The default view of the portal is dependent on the culture of the user, which is obtained from the user's profile. A parameter to pass in the locale/culture is available for anonymous users. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Portal_Self/02r3000001m7000000/
getPortalSelf.title: portal

access.description: Indicates the level of access to your organization for anonymous users. If set to private, only members of the organization will be able to access your site. public allows public access

allSSL.description: Indicates if the organization is using SSL. If true, all calls made against resources that belong to the organization will require SSL. false is the default.

backgroundImage.description: The background image that displays behind all other components on the home page. Accept the default background image, specify a URL for a custom background image, or specify that no background image will display

basemapGalleryGroupQuery.description: The query that identifies the group containing the web maps that display in the basemap gallery for the map viewer

bingKey.description: The Bing key to use for web maps using Bing Maps

canListApps.description: An organization can list applications in the marketplace only if canListApps is true

canListData.description: An organization can list data services in the marketplace only if canListData is true

canListPreProvisionedItems.description: An organization can list pre-provisioned items in the marketplace only if canListPreProvisionedItems is true

canProvisionDirectPurchase.description: An organization can provision direct purchases in the marketplace without customer request only if canProvisionDirectPurchase is true

canSearchPublic.description: Includes or excludes public items, groups, and users in search queries. When canSearchPublic is false, no public items outside of the organization are included in searches. However, public items that are part of the organization are returned. The default is true

canShareBingPublic.description: The Bing key can be shared to the public and is returned as part of a portal's description call (/sharing/rest/portals/<orgid>). This requires the access of the portal to be set to public. The canShareBingPublic property is not returned publicly but only shown to users within the organization

canSharePublic.description: Allows or disallows an organization to share groups or items publicly. false denotes that content can not be shared with everyone. The default is true

canSignInArcGIS.description: Allows an organization with an enterprise IDP configured to be able to turn on or off the ArcGIS sign in. The default is true

canSignInIDP.description: Allows an organization with an enterprise IDP configured to be able to turn on or off the enterprise sign in. The default is true

colorSetsGroupQuery.description: The query that identifies the group containing the color sets used for rendering in the map viewer

commentsEnabled.description: Allows the organization to disable commenting. true is the default. When commentsEnabled is false, comments are hidden and not removed. numComments are set to zero for all items in the organization. Calls to add a comment and view comments will fail. If the organization re-enables comments, the comments display and numComments are restored

created.description: Date the organization was created, in UTC, using milliseconds since epoch

culture.description: The item locale information (language and country)

customBaseUrl.description: The custom base URL for the portal

defaultBaseMap.description: The default basemap displayed in the map viewer

featuredGroups.description: The featured groups for the organization. These are the groups that will be highlighted on the Groups page
featuredGroups.title: featuredGroups

featuredItemsGroupQuery.description: The query that identifies the group containing features items for the gallery. Set a Group ID or, if null, then the most viewed items in your organization are displayed in the gallery

helpBase.description: The helpBase property provides the base URL of the help documentation. This is used to build all the help URLs within the portal

helperServices.description: A JSON object of various services needed by client applications. They can be overridden by the organization or the portal

geocode.description: Array of ArcGIS GeocodeServers to use for geocoding

geometry.description: ArcGIS GeometryServer to use for geometry functions. URL to Geometry Service

hydrologoy.description: ArcGIS Geoprocessing services for hydrologic analysis. URL to Hydrology Service

printTask.description: ArcGIS PrintServer task to use for printing functionality. URL to Print Service

route.description: ArcGIS NAServer to use for routing functionality. URL to Network Analysis Service

closestFacility.description: ArcGIS NAServer service for synchronous closest facility analysis. URL to Network Analysis Service

asyncClosestFacility.description: ArcGIS Geoprocessing service for asynchronous closest facility analysis. URL to Network Analysis Service

elevation.description: ArcGIS Geoprocessing services for elevation analysis. URL to Elevation Service

elevationSync.description: ArcGIS Geoprocessing services for elevation analysis. URL to Elevation Service

traffic.description: ArcGIS TrafficMapServer service for traffic functionality. URL to Traffic Map Service

serviceArea.description: ArcGIS NAServer service for synchronous service-area analysis. URL to Network Analysis Service

asyncServiceArea.description: ArcGIS Geoprocessing service for asynchronous service-area analysis. URL to Network Analysis Service

syncVRP.description: ArcGIS NAServer service for solving synchronous vehicle routing problems. URL to Network Analysis Service

asyncVRP.description: ArcGIS Geoprocessing service for solving asynchronous vehicle routing problems. URL to Network Analysis Service

url.description: Hosted GPServices that perform analyses. URL for analysis service

geoenrichment.description: ArcGIS GeoenrichmentServer. URL to Geoenrichment Service

homePageFeaturedContent.description: The group that contains featured content to be displayed on the home page

homePageFeaturedContentCount.description: The number of featured items that can be displayed on the home page. The max is 100. Integers only

httpPort.description: The port used by the portal for HTTP communication

httpsPort.description: The port used by the portal for HTTPS communication

id.description: Organization ID. If null, then this is the default portal for anonymous and non-organizational users

ipCntryCode.description: The country code of the calling IP (ArcGIS Online only)

isPortal.description: Indicates if the portal is on premises

layerTemplatesGroupQuery.description: The query that identifies the group containing editing templates used in the map viewer

maxTokenExpiration.description: The maximum validity in minutes of tokens issued for users of the organization. -1 is the default and is a special value that indicates infinite timeout or permanent tokens. For tokens granted using OAuth2 authorization grant, it represents the maximum validity of refresh tokens. For access tokens, the maximum validity is the lower of two weeks or this value

modified.description: Date the organization was last modified, in UTC, milliseconds since epoch

portalProperties.description: Stores properties specific to the organization, for example the 'contact us' link. if the organization is public, the properties are visible to the anonymous user

visible.description: Whether or not portalProperties are visible

portalThumbnail.description: The URL to the thumbnail of the portal

showHomePageDescription.description: If true, the description of your organization displays on the home page

supportsHostedServices.description: Indicates if hosted services are supported

symbolSetsGroupQuery.description: The query that identifies the symbol set group for rendering in the map viewer

templatesGroupQuery.description: The query that identifies the template group used in the map viewer

thumbnail.description: The URL to the thumbnail of the organization

units.description: Sets the units of measure for the organization's users. The user default is derived from the organization's Region. Set units to english for US standards or metric

urlKey.description: The prefix selected by the organization's administrator to be used with the customBaseURL

useStandardizedQuery.description: If true, only simple where clauses that are complaint with SQL92 can be used when querying layers and tables. The recommended security setting is true

getPortalServer.description: This resource represents an ArcGIS Server site that has been federated with the portal. This resource is not applicable to ArcGIS Online; it is only applicable to Portal for ArcGIS. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Server/02r300000219000000/
getPortalServer.title: server

id.description: ID of the ArcGIS Server site

name.description: The fully qualified name of the machine hosting the ArcGIS Server site, followed by the port

adminUrl.description: The administrative URL of the ArcGIS Server site, using the fully qualified name of the machine

url.description: The externally visible URL of the ArcGIS Server site, using the fully qualified name of the machine

isHosted.description: A Boolean property denoting whether the ArcGIS Server site is allowed to host services for the portal (true) or is not allowed to host services (false)

serverKey.description: The key returned when the Register Server operation is called for this server. The key is only displayed once; hence, this property usually returns null

serverType.description: The type of server being registered with the portal. For example: ArcGIS

getPortalServers.description: This resource lists the ArcGIS Server sites that have been federated with the portal. This resource is not applicable to ArcGIS Online; it is only applicable to Portal for ArcGIS. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Servers/02r300000218000000/
getPortalServers.title: servers

servers.description: An array of JSON objects representing ArcGIS Server sites

getRegisteredAppInfo.description: An app registered with the portal. An app item can be registered by invoking the register app operation. Every registered app gets an App ID and App Secret which in OAuth speak are known as client_id and client_secret respectively. The app owner has access to the registered app resource. This would include the organization administrator as well. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/index.html#/Registered_App/02r30000026v000000/
getRegisteredAppInfo.title: registeredApp

itemId.description: The unique ID for this item

client_id.description: The ID of the registered application. Also referred to as APPID

client_secret.description: The secret of the registered application. Also referred to as APPSECRET

appType.description: The type of app that was registered indicating whether it's a browser app, native app, server app or a multiple interface app

redirect_uris.description: The URIs where the access_token or authorization code will be delivered to upon successful authorization. The redirect_uri specified during authorization must be match one of the registered URIs otherwise authorization will be rejected. A special value of urn:ietf:wg:oauth:2.0:oob can also be specified for authorization grants. This will result in the authorization code being delivered to a portal URL (/oauth2/approval). This value is typically used by applications that don't have a web server or a custom URI scheme to deliver the code to. The value is a JSON string array

created.description: The date when the app was created (in UNIX time in milliseconds)

modified.description: The date when the app was last modified (in UNIX time in milliseconds)

getRelatedItems.description: Gets all the related items of a certain relationship type for that item. An optional direction can be specified if the direction of the relationship is ambiguous. Otherwise, the service will try to infer it. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/index.html#/Related_Items/02r300000085000000/
getRelatedItems.title: Related Items

total.description: The number of items related using the provided relationship type

relatedItems.description: A JSON array of related item objects

getUser.description: A user resource representing a registered user of the portal. Personal details of the user, such as e-mail and groups, are returned only to the user or the administrator of the user's organization (the properties in the Response Properties table below). A user is not visible to any other user (except the organization's administrator) if their access setting is set to private. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/index.html#/User/02r3000000m2000000/
getUser.title: user

username.description: The username of the given user

preferredView.description: The user's preferred view for content, either web or GIS

idpUsername.description: The original username if using enterprise logins

favGroupId.description: The user's favorites group and is created automatically for each user

lastLogin.description: The last login date of the user
