access.description: Indicates the level of access of the user: private, org, or public. If private, the user descriptive information will not be available to others nor will the username be searchable

storageusage.description: The amount of storage used for the user's subscription

storageQuota.description: Applicable to public users as it sets the total amount of storage available for a subscription. The maximum quota is 2GB

orgId.description: The ID of the organization the user belongs to

role.description: Defines the user's role in the organization: administrator (org_admin), publisher (org_publisher), information worker (org_user), or custom (<custom_role_name>)

disabled.description: Disables access to the organization by the user

tags.description: User-defined tags that describe the user

culture.description: The item locale information (language and country)

region.description: The user preferred region, used to set the featured maps on the home page, content in the gallery, and the default extent of new maps in the Viewer

thumbnail.description: The file name of the thumbnail used for the user. All user thumbnails are relative to the URL http://<community-url>/users/<userName>/info

created.description: The date the user was created. Shown in UNIX time

modified.description: The date the user was last modified. Shown in UNIX time

groups.description: A JSON array of groups the user belongs to. See Group for properties of a group

provider.description: The identity provider for the organization. Either arcgis (for built-in users) or enterprise (for external users managed by an enterprise identity store). This was added at Portal for ArcGIS 10.3.1

getUserContent.description: The user's content are items either in the home folder for the user, e.g. /content/users/<username>, or in a subfolder of the home folder with the given folder ID. Multilevel folders are not supported. You can also see the Quick reference topic for additional information on this. Items in a folder are stored by reference and are not physically in a folder. Rather, they're stored as links to the original item, e.g. /content/items/<itemId>. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/index.html#/User_Content/02r30000007p000000/
getUserContent.title: userContent

items.description: The list of the user's items. See Item for response properties for more details

getUserInvitation.description: An individual invitation to join a given group. The user can accept the invitation or decline the invitation. Invitations are currently only to join groups but may be extended in the future to allow for other targetTypes. Developers should design their applications so that targetTypes is checked and unknown targetTypes are ignored. Invitations are also currently only sent to usernames. This is determined by the type property of the invitation. In the future, other types of invitations may be introduced. Developers should design their applications to make sure they check type and ignore unknown types. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/index.html#/User_Invitation/02r3000000mr000000/
getUserInvitation.title: userInvitation

targetType.description: The type of invitation. For now, this will only be set to group, but other types may be added in the future

targetId.description: The ID of the group (if targetType is set to group) that the user is invited to join

received.description: The date received. Shown in UNIX time in milliseconds

role.description: The role that the invitee will have in the group, either group_member or group_admin

expiration.description: Expiration of the invitation. Shown in UNIX time in milliseconds

type.description: For now, always set to "user." In the future, the type may include other types of invitations

created.description: The date the invitation was created. Shown in UNIX time in milliseconds

username.description: The name of the user receiving the invitation if the type is set to "user.

fromUsername.description: A JSON object about the user who sent the invitation. This includes their username and fullname

fullname.description: The full name of the user who sent the invitation

getUserInvitations.description: Shows the invitations sent to the authenticated user. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/index.html#/User_Invitations/02r3000000m7000000/
getUserInvitations.title: userInvitations

userInvitations.description: A JSON array of invitation objects. For details, see the response properties for User Invitation

getUsers.description: Lists all the members of the organization. The start and num paging parameters are supported. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Users/02r30000009q000000/
getUsers.title: users

total.description: The total number of results found

start.description: The number of the first entry in the result set response. The index number is 1-based

num.description: The number of results included in this result set response

nextStart.description: The next entry index if the current result set doesn't contain all results

users.description: A JSON array of user objects. See User for possible response properties

getUserTag.description: User tag. Object in the userTags array. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/index.html#/User_Tags/02r3000000m9000000/
getUserTag.title: userTag

count.description: The number of times the tag was used

getUserTags.description: Users tag the content they publish in their portal via the add and update item calls. This resource lists all the tags used by the user along with the number of times the tags have been used. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/index.html#/User_Tags/02r3000000m9000000/
getUserTags.title: userTags

tags.description: Array of tag objects. Each tag object contains a tag property with the name of the tag along with a count that reports the number of times the tag was used

groupSearch.description: The Group Search operation searches for groups in the portal. The search index is updated whenever groups and organizations are created, updated, or deleted. There can be a lag between the time that a group is updated and the time when it's reflected in the search results. The results only contain groups that the user has permission to access. Care should be taken when using ArcGIS REST API search operations (search, user search, group search) to find items, groups, and users programmatically. The Portal uses a powerful search engine to index information and to allow full text searching on it. This search engine uses many different inputs to find the appropriate results and rank them. This often makes search 'fuzzy', making it ideal for human interaction, but not necessarily ideal for looking for specific records programmatically. Developers should avoid using search to find specific items (e.g. by title) as the results of these types of queries might change as the search engine evolves. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Group_Search/02r3000000m1000000/
groupSearch.title: groupSearch

total.description: The total number of results found for the whole query. The number of query results is limited to 10000

start.description: The number of the first entry in the result set for this response. The index number is 1-based

num.description: The number of results included in the result set for this response

nextStart.description: The next entry index if the current result set doesn't contain all results

results.description: A JSON array of group objects. See the response properties for Group

inviteToGroup.description: A group administrator can invite users to join their group using the Invite to Group operation. This creates a new user invitation, which the users accept or decline. The role of the user and the invitation expiration date can be set in the invitation. A notification is created for the user indicating that they were invited to join the group. Available only to authenticated users. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Invite_to_Group/02r30000006v000000/
inviteToGroup.title: inviteToGroup

success.description: Indicates if the operation was successful

groupId.description: The groupId of the invited group

joinGroup.description: Users apply to join a group using the Join Group operation (POST only). This creates a new group application, which the group administrators accept or decline. This operation also creates a notification for the user indicating that they have applied to join this group. Available only to authenticated users. Users can only apply to join groups to which they have access. If the group is private, users will not be able to find it to ask to join it. Information pertaining to the applying user, such as their full name and username, can be sent as part of the group application. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Join_Group/02r30000006n000000/
joinGroup.title: joinGroup

success.description: Indicates if the operation was successful

groupId.description: The ID of the group the user asked to join

leaveGroup.description: The Leave Group operation (POST only) is available to all group members other than the group owner. Leaving a group automatically results in the unsharing of all items the user has shared with the group. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Leave_Group/02r30000006z000000/
leaveGroup.title: leaveGroup

success.description: Indicates if the operation was successful

groupId.description: The ID of the group the user left

reassignGroup.description: The Reassign Group operation (POST only) allows the administrator of an organization to reassign a group to another member of the organization. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Reassign_Group/02r300000067000000/
reassignGroup.title: reassignGroup

success.description: Indicates if the operation was successful

groupId.description: The ID of the reassigned group

removeUsersFromGroup.description: The operation to Remove Users From Group (POST only) is available only to the group administrators, including the owner, and to the administrator of the organization if the user is a member. Both users and admins can be removed using this operation. Group owners cannot be removed from the group. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Remove_Users_From_Group/02r300000066000000/
removeUsersFromGroup.title: removeUsersFromGroup

notRemoved.description: A JSON array of usernames that were not removed. This can happen when the username was never a member of the group

search.description: This operation searches for content items in the portal. The searches are performed against a high performance index that indexes the most popular fields of an item. See the Search reference page for information on the fields and the syntax of the query. The search index is updated whenever users add, update, or delete content. There can be a lag between the time that the content is updated and the time when it's reflected in the search results. The results of a search only contain items that the user has permission to access. Care should be taken when using ArcGIS REST API search operations (search, user search, group search) to find items, groups, and users programmatically. The Portal uses a powerful search engine to index information and to allow full text searching on it. This search engine uses many different inputs to find the appropriate results and rank them. This often makes search 'fuzzy', making it ideal for human interaction, but not necessarily ideal for looking for specific records programmatically. Developers should avoid using search to find specific items (e.g. by title) as the results of these types of queries might change as the search engine evolves. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Search/02r3000000mp000000/
search.title: search

total.description: The total number of results found for the whole query. The number of query results is limited to 10000

start.description: The number of the first entry in the result set for this response. The index number is 1-based

num.description: The number of results included in the result set for this response

nextStart.description: The next entry index if the current result set doesn't contain all results

results.description: A JSON array of item objects. See the response properties of an item

searchUsers.description: The User Search operation searches for users in the portal. The search index is updated whenever users are created, updated, or deleted. There can be a lag between the time that the user is updated and the time when it's reflected in the search results. The results only contain users that the calling user has permissions to see. Users can control this visibility by changing the access property of their user. Care should be taken when using ArcGIS REST API search operations (search, user search, group search) to find items, groups, and users programmatically. The Portal uses a powerful search engine to index information and to allow full text searching on it. This search engine uses many different inputs to find the appropriate results and rank them. This often makes search 'fuzzy', making it ideal for human interaction, but not necessarily ideal for looking for specific records programmatically. Developers should avoid using search to find specific items (e.g. by title) as the results of these types of queries might change as the search engine evolves. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/User_Search/02r3000000m6000000/
searchUsers.title: userSearch

total.description: The total number of results found for the whole query. The number of query results is limited to 10000

start.description: The number of the first entry in the result set for this response. The index number is 1-based

num.description: The number of results included in the result set for this response

nextStart.description: The next entry index if the current result set doesn't contain all results

results.description: A JSON array of user objects. See the response properties for User

searchUsersResultItem.description: Result item of searching for Users http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/User_Search/02r3000000m6000000/
searchUsersResultItem.title: searchUsersResultItem

created.description: The date the user was created. Shown in UNIX time

culture.description: The item locale information (language and country)

modified.description: The date the user was last modified. Shown in UNIX time

provider.description: The identity provider for the organization. Either arcgis (for built-in users) or enterprise (for external users managed by an enterprise identity store). This was added at Portal for ArcGIS 10.3.1

region.description: The user preferred region, used to set the featured maps on the home page, content in the gallery, and the default extent of new maps in the Viewer

tags.description: User-defined tags that describe the user

thumbnail.description: The file name of the thumbnail used for the user. All user thumbnails are relative to the URL http://<community-url>/users/<userName>/info

username.description: The username of the given user

updateGroup.description: The Update Group operation (POST only) modifies properties such as the group title, tags, description, sort field and order, and member sharing capabilities. Available only to the group administrators or to the administrator of the organization if the user is a member. Only the properties that are to be updated need to be specified in the request. Properties not specified will not be affected. The group ID cannot be modified. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Update_Group/02r30000006w000000/
updateGroup.title: updateGroup

success.description: Indicates if the operation was successful

groupId.description: The ID of the updated group

updateUser.description: The Update User operation (POST only) modifies properties such as description, preferred view, tags, access, and thumbnail. The user name cannot be modified. For the 'ecas' identity provider, password, e-mail, and full name must be modified by editing your Esri Global Account. For the 'arcgis' identity provider, password, full name, security question, and security answer can be updated with Update User. Update User is available only to the user or to the administrator of the user's organization. Only the properties that are to be updated need to be specified in the request. Properties not specified will not be affected. http://resources.arcgis.com/en/help/arcgis-rest-api/#/Update_User/02r3000000m0000000/
updateUser.title: updateUser

success.description: Indicates if the operation was successful

username.description: The username of the modified user
